title: kihara_souji
body:

He has short [[grey hair]] with short [[bangs]], and [[brown eyes]].  His character sheet depicts him wearing a [[black shirt|black]] [[dress shirt|dress]] [[shirt]] under a [[white coat|white]] [[lab coat]], [[black pants]], [[black gloves|black]] [[gloves]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[shoes]]. title: sekia_hills_circuit
body:
Sekia Hills was a Japanese [[racetrack]] specifically designed for drifting, notable for being one of the main recurring tracks  for [[D1 Grand Prix]] and being featured in many Japanese drifting videos in the 90s and early 00s.

The track was closed in 2012, and the land it was on has since been converted into a solar energy farm.

title: kurumada_blast-off
body:
When a character is sent flying away by a powerful attack in a manner frequently seen in the works of [[Kurumada Masami]]. Occurs often in the aftermath of [[Saint Seiya]] finishing moves, as well as uppercuts in [[Ring ni Kakero]]. The victim is usually depicted with all limbs splayed and their head lolling back as they are flung away from the point of impact. 

This is often parodied in various works.

title: trireme
body:
A trireme was an ancient vessel and a type of galley that was used by the ancient maritime civilizations of the Mediterranean Sea, especially the Phoenicians, ancient [[Greece|Greeks]] and [[roman empire|Romans]].

The trireme derives its name from its three rows of oars, manned with one man per oar. The early trireme was a development of the penteconter, an ancient warship with a single row of 25 oars on each side (i.e., a single-banked boat), and of the bireme, a warship with two banks of oars, of Phoenician origin. The word dieres does not appear until the Roman period. AAs a ship, it was fast and agile and was the dominant warship in the Mediterranean from the 7th to the 4th centuries BC, after which it was largely superseded by the larger quadriremes and quinqueremes. Triremes played a vital role in the Persian Wars, the creation of the Athenian maritime empire and its downfall during the Peloponnesian War.

Medieval and early modern galleys with three files of oarsmen per side are sometimes referred to as triremes.

title: aek-971
body:
The [b]AK-47[/b] ([b]А[/b]втомат [b]е[/b]диный [b]К[/b]окшарова 971) is a selective fire 5.45×39mm  [b][[assault rifle]][/b] of [[Soviet]] origin, that was developed at the Kovrov Mechanical Plant (KMZ) by chief designer [[Stanislav Ivanovich Koksharov]]. 

The AEK-971 is based on previous [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] rifles in internal design and layout, but features a Balanced Automatics Recoil System (BARS) that enhances the traditional Kalashnikov long stroke gas piston operating system by reducing the negative effects of recoil. The AEK-971's iron sights features an adjustable notched rear tangent rear sight calibrated in 100 m (109 yd) increments from 100 to 1,000 m (109 to 1,094 yd) and a hooded front post. Each AEK assault rifle is fitted with a Warsaw Pact side-rail bracket for mounting optics. It is fed through [[AK-74]], [[RPK-74]] pattern 5.45×39mm 30-round or larger box magazines.

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: AK-47":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AEK-971

title: flock
body:
Multiple birds (near always the same species) behaving as a group. Distinct from [[too_many_birds]] in that the birds must be a grouping in some way (Eg, being clustered together or flying together), for instance a pet store featuring countless cages with a few birds each or a series of taxidermy animals would be not count as flock but could be too_many_birds.


[[Too_many_birds]] not [[flock]]: post #6692857 post #6949868 post #114802
[[Flock]] and [[too_many_birds]]: post #6709824 post #5779985 post #6626571 post #6237359

In cases where a character is surrounded by birds that appear to have been startled post #6244855 it is generally safe to tag flock.

title: ruan
body:
The [b]Ruan[/b] (阮) traditional Chinese plucked string musical instrument. It is very similar to a [[pipa (instrument)|pipa]], being a lute with a fretted neck, a circular body, and four strings., but it has a round circle, rather than pear, shaped base.

In classical Chinese from [[Han dynasty|Han]] to [[Tang dynasty|Tang]], pipa referred to any plucked-string instrument.  It is believed that ruan may have been descended from an instrument called xiantao (弦鼗) which was constructed by labourers on the [[Great Wall of China]] during the late [[Qin dynasty]] (hence the name Qin pipa) using strings stretched over a pellet drum. During the reign of [[Wu Zetian|Empress Wu Zetian]] (about 684–704 AD), a copper instrument that looked like the Qin pipa was discovered in an ancient tomb in Sichuan. Since Ruan Xian was an expert and famous in playing an instrument that looked like the Qin pipa, the instrument was named after him as ruanxian (阮咸) when the copper Qin pipa was found. Today it is shortened to ruan.

title: natsumon!
body:
Natsumon! is a 2023 adventure game developed by Millennium Kitchen and published by Spike Chunsoft for the Nintendo Switch. It follows the format of the [[Boku no Natsuyasumi]] series, allowing the player to experience a young boy's summer vacation. 

h4. Characters

title: mian_guan
body:
A type of headwear designed for kings and emperors of ancient China, Japan, Korea and Vietnam. Characterized by a square lacquered board placed on top of the headgear, with strands of jade beads draping from the two ends, which represent the rank of the wearer.

Originating in [[Chinese empire|China]], the mianguan was worn by the emperor, his ministers, and aristocrats. The mianguan was the most expensive [[Chinese Clothes|Chinese headware]], reserved for important sacrificial events. Regulations on its shape and its making were issued under the [[Han dynasty|Eastern Han dynasty]] and applied in the succeeding dynasties only to be ended at the fall of the [[Ming dynasty]] in the 16th century AD.

In Japan, emperors and nobles wore gold, silver, and gilt-bronze crowns, influenced by the Korean peninsula, from the Kofun period (mid 3rd century-7th century). In the 8th century, influenced by the Chinese mianguan, the unique benkan was born, a metal crown with chains and a sun-shaped ornament at the top. It is also worn in Vietnam, and the monarchs of the [[Joseon dynasty]] also wore an equivalent crown, the myeonlyugwan. 

h4.External links

* "Photo (the Dingling Museum of the Ming Tombs)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Chinese_Imperial_Mian,_Dingling.jpg]
* "A list of Guan, Jin, and other headwear":https://torguqin.wordpress.com/hanfu/hanfu-history/list/

title: furutaka_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Furutaka (Kancolle)|]]'s kai ni form.

On her second remodel, she now wears a [[bodysuit]] covering her torso, abdomen, hip, and ends at her shoulders and mid-thighs. She also wears a [[single elbow glove]] on her right arm and her single thighhigh has changed side. Her ship parts are now even bulkier, covering more of her right arm, and are held in place with a chain, all resembling the bow of a ship. The gear on her left leg has been streamlined and now features a catapult. She now wears actual shoes instead of the previous metal booties. Kako's [[hairclip|screw hairclips]] have been added. Her left eye is now [[glowing_eye|glowing]] brightly, with a spark being added to emphasize the effect.

title: morichika_rinnosuke
body:
A half-human, half-youkai [[merchant]], and one of the only few named male characters in [[Touhou]].

He runs [[Kourindou]], an antiques shop near the [[Forest of Magic]] stocked with items found in the human world outside [[Gensokyo]], sometimes supplied by [[Yakumo Yukari|Yukari]]. [[Hakurei Reimu|Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]] often visit him, but rarely as customers.

He recently got a small [[robot dog]] pet, which he named [[Laika (touhou)|Laika]].

[[Doujinshi]] sometimes portray him either as a lecherous [[pervert]] running around wearing only a [[fundoshi]] or as an extremely [[muscular male]] with power almost equal to the rest of the cast - dubbed [[MANnosuke]].

He makes a cameo in the background of the [[human village (touhou)|Human Village]] stage in [i][[Hopeless Masquerade]][/i], his first official in-game appearance of any kind.

body:

A 10th dan [[karate]] grandmaster and head of the Shinshinkai school of karate. Doppo is an expert martial artist who takes pride in his strength, yet also humble enough to acknowledged his weakness when being bested in a fight. [[Orochi Katsumi]] is his adopted son.

He loses his right eye after a fight with [[Hanma Yujiro]], though he has gained the respect from Yujiro for his prowess and determination to improve himself and the two later become friends. Doppo are one of the fighters who played a large part in the development of Yujiro's son [[Hanma Baki|Baki]] to become "The Strongest Creature on Earth".

title: pp-19-01_vityaz
body:
PP-19-01 (also known as [b]Vityaz SN[/b]) is a closed-bolt, blowback, 9×19mm Parabellum [b][[submachine gun]][/b] developed in 2004 by [b]Russian[/b] small arms manufacturer Izhmash ("Kalashnikov Concern":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kalashnikov_Concern]). It is heavily based on the [b]AK platform[/b] and offers a high degree of parts commonality with the [[AK-74]]. The [[gun]] is directly developed from the [[PP-19 Bizon]]. "Vityaz" (витязь) is [[russian text|Russian]] word for "[[knight]]".

The weapon is fed from a standard 30-round box [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] and comes with a fastening device that joins two magazines together. It can fire high-pressure "7N31":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/9×19mm_Parabellum#Russian_military_overpressure_variants] [[ammunition|round]] that can penetrate soft [[body armor|body armour]].

A wire-like weapon designed specifically for silent assassination, torture, or execution by strangling the victim with the garrote and applying pressure.

[[Chocolate Misu]], [[Walter C. Dornez]] and [[machi komacine|Machi]] use them as their primary weapons, although not necessarily for strangling. Walter is known for slicing apart his enemies, while Chocolate uses it as a piercing weapon.

title: gakkou_no_kaidan_(anime)
body:
[b]Gakkou no Kaidan[/b] ([i]School Ghost Stories[/i] in English) is a 2000 paranormal anime series, based on the childrens' books of the same name by Toru Tsunemitsu. Produced by Aniplex, made by Studio Pierrot and airing on Fuji TV, the show was an initial success in Japan, albeit with little merchandising and lackluster reruns. Animax would produce an English-language dub entitled '[i]Ghost at School[/i]' in 2004 for airing in other Asian markets. ADV Films would gain the rights for its English dub in native English markets a year later, with Aniplex only listing three criteria for the dub to meet in its contract:

1. Do not change the names of any characters, including the ghosts. 
2. Do not change the way any ghost is killed, as it is based on Japanese folklore. 
3. Do not change the core meaning of any episode.

The resulting dub, known as [b]Ghost Stories[/b], would turn the series into a comedic self-parody, dramatically changing almost all of the characters' personalities, while otherwise roughly following the criteria listed. ADV's new, dark-comedy version turned out to be a hit, and the show took on a new international cult following, far overshadowing the original series and the first dub. Its success was such that it even led to misinformation surrounding the success of the series in Japan proper.

h4. Characters

* [[Miyanoshita Satsuki]]
* [[Koigakubo Momoko]]

title: imagawayaki
body:
[b]Imagawayaki[/b] (今川焼き) is a Japanese [[dessert]] often found at Japanese [[festival]]s as well as outside Japan. It is made of batter in a special pan (similar to a [[waffle]] iron but without the honeycomb pattern), and filled with sweet azuki [[red bean paste]], although it is becoming increasingly popular to use a wider variety of fillings such as vanilla [[custard]], fruit custards/preserves, curry, various meats, vegetables, potatoes, or mayonnaise. Imagawayaki are similar to [[Dorayaki]], but the latter are two separate pancakes sandwiched around the filling after cooking, and are often served cold.

Imagawayaki began to be sold near the Kanda Imagawabashi bridge during An'ei years (1772–1781) in the Edo period. The name of Imagawayaki originates from this time.

(From Wikipedia)

The Imagawayaki is famous for its numerous names, regional and store brands, "Imagawayaki" even just being the primary name in the Kantō region. The main joke involving this treat is really just pointing out it has many names, making a new name for it, or identifying a character's native region by how they name it. The only name that reached any sort of consensus is "[b]Baked Mochocho[/b]" and it's only because it's a ridiculous joke name.

h4. Further information

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imagawayaki

title: bfg_9000
body:
The [b]BFG 9000[/b], short for [b]Blast Field Generator 9000[/b] ([b]Bio Force Gun version 3.14[/b] in the 2005 movie), or more commonly known as the [b]Big Fucking Gun 9000[/b], is a weapon featured consistently throughout the [[Doom (series)|]] games. 

It is [[Doomguy]]'s most powerful weapon, firing a large green energy ball that obliterates anything it touches and emits tracers for extra damage.

In the original Doom series, the BFG works in an unintuitive way. When the trigger is pulled, there is a slight delay before a large green plasma ball is ejected. After the green ball hits any object, there is another slight delay before 40 invisible tracers are emitted from the player's body in a cone shape, like a shotgun blast, in the same direction the plasma ball was originally fired. The green ball itself deals significant damage to enemies when hit, but most of the potential damage from a BFG shot is from the tracers. Sufficiently skilled players can take advantage of this and consistently kill a [[Cyberdemon]], a boss monster with the most health in the game, in two BFG shots. This requires getting very close at the right times to maximize the number of tracers hitting the enemy, which is risky because the cyberdemon's rocket launcher is extremely damaging, guaranteed to one-shot players who have no armor or extra health.

h4. Designs
* Doom, Doom II
* Doom 64
* Quake II (BFG 10000)
* Quake III Arena (BFG 10000)
* Doom 3
* Doom (2005 movie)
* Doom 2016, Doom Eternal

h4. See also
* [[Doom (series)]]
* [[BFG 10000 (Doom Eternal)|]]

h4. External links
* "Doom Wiki - BFG 9000":https://doomwiki.org/wiki/BFG9000

Fast Five is notably regarded as a "transitional entry" in the series, as it is the first one to fully embrace the action and heist genre that the would become the series' standard going forward.

This entry is known as [b]Wild Speed Mega Max[/b] in Japan.

title: stunner
body:
A wrestling move in which an attacker reaches behind and grabs the head of an opponent, just before the attacker drops to a seated position causing the opponent's jaw to slam into the attacker's shoulder (a seated three-quarter facelock jawbreaker maneuver). The free hand is sometimes used to hold the top of the head.

Made famous by Stone Cold Steve Austin, and named for his Stone Cold Stunner finisher. Though Austin popularized the Stunner, it is actually innovated by ECW wrestler Mikey Whipwreck who called it the [i]Whipper-Snapper[/i]. Other users of the Stunner include [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling]] wrestler Willie Mack and [[WWE]] wrestlers [[Kevin Owens]] and Ember Moon (who uses a a diving corkscrew variant which she calls the [i]Eclipse[/i]). [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler Athena uses a diving corkscrew variant which she calls the [i]O-Face[/i] and the [I]Eclipse[/I] in WWE.

h4. See Also:

* "Wikipedia Article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stunner_%28professional_wrestling%29
* [[wrestling]]

title: lariat
body:
In wrestling, a lariat is when an attacking wrestler runs towards an opponent, wraps his arm around their upper chest and neck and then forces them to the ground. This move is similar to a clothesline, the difference being that in a [[clotheslining|clothesline]] the wrestler's arm is kept straight to the side of the wrestler during the move, while in the lariat the wrestler strikes their opponent with his arm.

There are multiple variants of lariat:

1) Northern Lariat or Enzui Lariat: A lariat to the back of the opponent's neck and shoulders. Used by [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling]] alumnus and current [[WWE]] superstar Robert Roode.

2) Burning Lariat or Short Range Lariat: A lariat where the wrestler doesn't run but simply strikes the opponent while standing next to him. The wrestler can also hold the opponent's head up before performing the lariat with his other arm. The Burning Lariat is a common variant among Japanese wrestlers, with retired Japanese wrestler Kobashi Kenta among of the users of this variation. 

3) Short-arm Lariat: A variation where the wrestler grabs one of the opponent's wrists with his hand and pulls the opponent closer, striking him with the lariat with his other arm. [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] wrestler [[Okada Kazuchika]]'s [[Rainmaker (wrestling)|Rainmaker]] finishing move is a variation of this, where he holds his opponent in a ripcord position then spins him out to hit the short-arm lariat.

4) Discus Lariat: The wrestler spins in place before he hits the lariat. Used by the late [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler/WWE alumnus Mr. Brodie Lee (a.k.a. Luke Harper)

Typically, a lariat is used as a finishing move while the clothesline is simply a basic strike attack. The main difference aside from the mechanics of the movement is the stiffness. Lariats are essentially a very stiff clothesline used as a finisher rather than a basic strike.

title: calf_slicer
body: Also known as a [i]Calf Crusher[/i], it is a compression-type [[submission hold]] that involves pressing the calf and/or thigh muscle into one of the bones in the leg. It can be applied by inserting an arm or leg in the backside of the knee, and flexing the opponent's leg to apply pressure to the muscles surrounding the fulcrum. Generally, the direction of the shin in the leg acting as a fulcrum will determine where the larger part of the pressure will go. Such calf slicers can be used as effective [[leg lock|leg locks]] to the knee through a separating and elongating motion. The calf slicer is listed as a banned technique in the lower levels of some major Brazilian jiu-jitsu competitions. [[WWE]] Wrestler [[AJ Styles]] uses this as one of his finishers, calling it the [i]Calf Killer[/i] in [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] and [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling|TNA]] and the [i]Calf Crusher[/i] in WWE.

title: merriell_allesandro_shelton
body:
[b]Corporal Merriell Allesandro "SNAFU" Shelton[/b] (January 21, 1922 – May 3, 1993) was a [[United States]] [[united_states_marine_corps|Marine]] who served in the Pacific theater during [[World War II]]. 

He is depicted in the 1981 memoir With the Old Breed: At [[battle_of_peleliu|Peleliu]] and [[battle_of_okinawa|Okinawa]] by [[Eugene Bondurant Sledge]] which chronicled their combat experiences. Snafu also appears as a character in the HBO miniseries [[The Pacific]] (2010), in which he is portrayed by American-[[Egypt]]ian actor "Rami Malek":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rami_Malek.

title: sergeant_romus_valton_burgin
body:
[b]Sergeant Romus Valton "R.V." Burgin[/b] (August 13, 1922 – April 6, 2019) was a [[United States]] [[united_states_marine_corps|Marine]] and American author. As a young man, he served in the Pacific Theater during [[World War II]].

Burgin was the author of the memoir [b]Islands of the Damned: A Marine at War in the Pacific[/b] (with William Marvel). He is portrayed in the HBO miniseries [[The Pacific]] by [[ireland|Irish]] actor "Martin McCann":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_McCann_(actor). Burgin himself appears as an old man with glasses in documentary footage during the miniseries.

title: squidbeak_splatoon
body:
The Squidbeak Splatoon was formed by [[Cap'n Cuttlefish]] after the Great [[Zapfish]] was stolen by the Octarians. He recruited [spoiler]his granddaughters, [[Callie (splatoon)|]] and [[Marie (splatoon)|]],[/spoiler] into the platoon to search for the missing Zapfish, and later persuaded Agent 3 to join the platoon as well.

This tag is for characters wearing a Squidbeak Splatoon member's costume.

h4. Members

h6. Agent 1

AKA [spoiler]Callie[/spoiler], depicted wearing a purple [[beanie]] with a [[star hat ornament]], [[sunglasses]], and a purple top.

h6. Agent 2

AKA [spoiler]Marie[/spoiler], depicted wearing a green [[baseball cap]], a face mask, and a green top.

h6. Agent 3

The [[inkling player character]] protagonist of [i][[Splatoon 1]][/i]'s Hero Mode, and can be depicted as either gender, though they are often drawn as a girl with [[green_hair|green]] [[tentacle hair]] thanks to promotional materials surrounding Hero Mode. Agent 3's costume consists of a bright yellow safety vest and pointed [[headgear]].

h6. Agent 4

The inkling protagonist of [i][[Splatoon 2]][/i]'s Hero mode, and can appear as varied as Agent 3, although most depictions are drawn as a girl with [[orange_hair|orange]] or [[blonde_hair|yellow]] hair. Agent 4's main costume difference is a [[yellow coat]].

h6. Agent 8

The protagonist of the Splatoon 2 DLC [i][[splatoon 2: octo expansion|Octo Expansion]][/i]. Unlike previous agents, Agent 8 is an [[octoling player character]], whose most common promotional appearance is with  [[purple hair]] and [[dark skin|dark]] (if girl) or [[pale skin]] (if boy).

h6. New Agent 3
The protagonist of [i][[Splatoon 3]][/i]'s Hero Mode. Like the original Agent 3 and Agent 4, their appearance is varied, but the one in promotional art will be an inkling girl and have [[blonde hair]] in a side braid, and either a yellow coat or a [[crop top]]. This is the first story mode character that can be an [[Inkling player character]] or an [[Octoling player character]].

title: thrasher_damnd
body:
A character in the [[Final Fight]] series of fighting games from [[Capcom]], and the first boss the player faces in the original Final Fight [[video game]] from the late 80s. His full name, revealed in [[Street Fighter 6]] is [b]Thrasher Damnd[/b], a combination of his censored westernized name and his original Japanese name.

[b]Damnd[/b] is a member of the [[Mad Gear]] gang that terrorized [[Metro City]]. He is a tall, [[muscular]] bound [[dark skin]]ned individual of Caribbean origin (specifically the Dominican Republic) with blonde dyed [[dreadlocks]], [[sunglasses]] and an exotic Jamaican styled outfit. 

He later appeared in [[Street Fighter 6]] as a minor antagonist and NPC in World Tour mode, where he is attempting to revive the Mad Gear gang and recruit [[player character (street fighter 6)|the player's avatar]] to join his gang.

title: mabinogi_heroes
body: Mabinogi Heroes (known in the West under the title of [i]Vindictus[/i]) is an MMORPG that is a prequel to the original [[Mabinogi]] by Nexon, set during the dark period in Mabinogi's history called the "Fomor Wars." It is a violent and action-intensive game that uses Valve's physics engine and allows players to pick up and throw just about anything in the environment at enemies. title: rococo_movement
body:
Rococo was an art movement that peaked in [[France]] during the mid 18th-century. It is characterized by being extremely ornate, with intricate scrolling curves, floral motifs, pastel colors, and heavy use of gilding. At the height of its popularity, Rococo influenced architecture, fashion, furniture design, painting, and sculpture.

This tag is for images that feature Rococo influence in some way.

h4.See also
* [[art nouveau]]
* [[goth fashion]]
* [[renaissance]]

title: gothic_architecture
body:
A style of architecture which flourished during the high and late medieval period. - Wikipedia

Used to tag buildings that reflect a Gothic design. This is loosely defined and includes Early Gothic and Gothic Revival structures as well.

Characteristic design elements include the "ogive":http://www.gutenberg.org/files/33837/33837-h/33837-h.htm#fig54 (pointed arch), the "ribbed vault":http://www.pitt.edu/~medart/menuglossary/ribvault.htm, and the [[flying buttress]].

h4. See also

* [[East Asian architecture]]
* [[goth fashion]]

title: gobots
body:
[quote][i]"The Gobots are like the K-Mart of Transformers..." - "Clerks II":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clerks_II [/i][/quote]

[i][b]GoBots[/b][/i] was a line of transforming [[robot]] [[toy]]s produced by Tonka from 1983 to 1987, similar (and a rival toy line) to [[Transformers]]. 

Contrary to popular belief, [b]the GoBots brand was actually started a whole year before Transformers[/b].

The GoBots line was based on original Japanese robot toys from the first line of toys of a 1982 franchise called [[Machine Robo]] (マシンロボ) and helped create the toy robot "sensation" that swept 80s USA for a short time. The line sold well initially, but was eventually overtaken by Transformers.

Hanna Barbera produced a cartoon series called [i]Challenge of the GoBots[/i] to promote the toyline, which ran for 65 22-minute episodes from 1984 to 1985. 

The main tagline for the original animated TV series was: [i]"GoBots - Mighty Robots!!! Mighty Vehicles!!!".[/i]
 
In 1986, soon after the end of the Challenge of the Gobots television series, the Gobots co-starred with the [i]"Rock Lords":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_Lords [/i]in an animated feature film [i]GoBots: Battle of the Rock Lords[/i], again produced by Hanna Barbera.

Although initially a separate and competing franchise, Tonka's Gobots became the intellectual property of Hasbro (owners of Transformers) after their buyout of Tonka in 1991. Subsequently, the universe depicted in the animated series Challenge of the GoBots and follow-up film GoBots: Battle of the Rock Lords was established as an alternate universe within the Transformers franchise.
 
While [[Hasbro]] now owns the fictional side of the property (character names, bios, storyline), the original vintage toys and their likenesses were only licensed from [[Bandai Namco]] in the 80s, were not covered by the Tonka acquisition, and are not available for Hasbro use.

title: donetsk_people's_republic_flag
body:
The [[flag]] of the Donetsk People’s Republic, an internationally unrecognized republic of [[Russia]] located in Ukraine's Donetsk Oblast. It was created by Russian-backed paramilitaries in 2014, and it initially operated as a breakaway state until it was annexed by Russia in 2022.

The design of the flag consists of a black stripe on top, a dark blue stripe in the center, and a red stripe on the bottom. On occasion, the region’s coat of arms may be displayed in the center, along with the Republic’s name written among it.

h4. See also
* [[Russo-Ukrainian war]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Donetsk People's Republic":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donetsk_People%27s_Republic
* "Wikipedia: Flag of Donetsk People's Republic":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Donetsk_People%27s_Republic

title: billhook
body:
A billhook is a tool for cutting branches and grape vines, usually with a curved, concave sickle-like blade. The length of the blade and handle varies.

The weapon version of the billhook is a [[polearm]] typically with a pointed spearhead and back spike or hook in addition to the curved blade, similar to a [[halberd]]. 

Don't mix this up with the similar [[hashitsuki nata]] and [[nata (tool)]], which usually have a flat side and for which the "nose" is perpendicular to the blade, while the end of billhooks curves downward.

h4. See also

* [[Scythe]]
* [[Sickle]]
* [[Glaive (polearm)]]
* [[Halberd]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: zooey_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i] character. Voiced by [[Koshimizu Ami]]. Also known as Primal Beast [b]Grand Order[/b], one of the Arbitrators who originated from [[Cosmos (granblue fantasy)|]].

Originally a summon. She was later on made into a raid boss, and afterwards into a playable character.

A [[dark skin|dark-skinned]] young woman with  long, [[ahoge|tufted]] blonde-tinted [[white hair]]. Her eye color in official art seems to fluctuate between [[red eyes|red]] and [[orange eyes|orange]]. She wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[armored dress]] and [[black thighhighs|black]] armored [[thighhighs]]. She wields a shield and an intensely blue sword.

She was given a limited summer version in 2016 despite not ever making it in the top ten female characters in popularity polls prior. This was probably to give players an easier alternative to get her, as her regular version requires one to purchase the official Granblue Fantasy visa card.

Gives herself the name [b]Zooey[/b] in her introduction fate episode, since her full name was hard to pronounce.

h4.Official alternate costumes
[[zooey (summer) (granblue fantasy)|Zooey Summer]]
other_names: ジ・オーダー・グランデ

title: erik_ahlberg
body:
A supporting character from the graphic novel and cartoon series [[hilda_(series)|Hilda]]. He's the highest-ranking member of the "Trolberg Safety Patrol", a Trolberg security agency keeping the town safe from potentially or actually dangerous magical creatures.
His main character flaw is being an extreme glory hound, ready to do anything to become as famous as his distant ancestor Edmund Ahlberg, leading him to concoct schemes that endangered other people and creatures, but in the end, [spoiler]he saw reason, saved his city and was able to facilitate peace between humans and trolls.[/spoiler]

body:
[b]Heroic Guerrila Fighter[/b]

A  [[monochrome]] "photo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guerrillero_Heroico] of [[Che Guevara]]. Commonly said to be the most famous and recreated photograph in history.

To this day, the photo is very disliked by the Cuban-American population of Florida ([[united_states|USA]]), but loved by the population of [[Cuba]].

title: wear_that_tight_red_dress_(meme)
body:
[quote]Beta Male: "So, where do you wanna go?"

Alpha Male: "You're going to have the best night of your life. I'll see you at 9 pm. Wear that tight red dress."
[tn]
Source: https://twitter.com/johnlees927/status/1589930573375541248
[/tn]
[/quote]
Originally a tweet meant to showcase the "alpha vs beta" mindset. It was meant portray how a man of each type asks a woman out, but it's easily misconstrued as a dialogue between two men, which made artists meme the tweet into [[crossdressing]] [[yaoi]] content.

h4. External Links
* "Earliest variant of the Tweet":https://twitter.com/BecomeAManAgain/status/1425130844394508296

title: let_him_cook_(meme)
body:
A macro meme consisting of the caption "Hold up... Let him cook", in response to someone doing something that is highly unusual, yet intriguing enough for the one who witness it that they let them continue.

Was popularized on a screencap from [[Kingdom Hearts III]] in which [[sheriff woody|Woody]] walks past [[sora_(kingdom_hearts)|Sora]] and gives a speech to Xehanort. The line is believed to originate from a Lil' B song.

title: guts_(berserk)
body:
[b]Guts[/b] is the main protagonist of [[Berserk]].

Known as "the Black Swordsman", he is a former mercenary who was [[Brand of Sacrifice|branded for sacrifice]] by the God Hand, and now seeks revenge against [[Griffith (berserk)|]], who betrayed him and cost him almost everything that he held dear. Only his love for [[Casca (berserk)|]] keeps him from going completely insane and becoming a creature of rage and hatred.

Guts's primary weapon in his one-man war against the God Hand is a massive [[sword]] known as the [[Dragonslayer (sword)|Dragon Slayer]], though he's also been known to employ a repeating crossbow, a set of throwing knives, a set of bombs, and a powerful gunpowder cannon built into the prosthesis that replaces the left hand that he lost during the Eclipse. For protection, he wears a pitch black set of [[armor]] named the [[Berserker Armor]], which feeds upon the user's negative emotions to fuel their strength.

h4. See also
* [[Beast of Darkness (berserk)|]]

title: bitter_melon
body:
Bitter melon is an oblong, wrinkly & warty textured, waxy-feeling vine fruit eaten primarily in southeast Asian cuisine. Its bitter flavor is considered an "acquired taste" to most Westerners and is strongly associated in Japan with Okinawan cuisine and with Okinawan longevity. It is one of the main ingredients of [[goya chanpuru]].

It also happens to be pronounced "goya", which is the nickname of [[i-58 (kancolle)|I-58 from Kantai Collection]]

h4.  See also

* [[Tag group:Food tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bitter melon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitter_melon

title: avengers_academy
body:
A 2016 mobile video game based on the [[Avengers (series)|]] franchise. The game reimagines members of the Avengers as students developing their superpowers. Avengers Academy ended service in 2019.

Particularly notable for featuring famous celebrities as voice actors for many of the initial launch characters, including [[John Cena]] as [[Hulk]].

Despite it's name, the game is completely unrelated to the "Avengers Academy comic run":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers_Academy].

title: xingchen
body:
Xingchen, also known as Stardust, is a [[VOCALOID]]4 developed by Shanghai HENIAN Information Technology Co. Ltd., in collaboration and distributed by Beijing Photek S&T Development Co., Ltd. in April 2016.

She is voiced by [i]Chalili (茶理理)[/i], a Chinese utaite. Her appearance was illustrated by [[Ideolo]] although the original concept was designed by [i]November[/i]. She has [[very long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] in [[quad tails]]. She wears a [[halterneck]] [[blue dress]] with [[elbow gloves|long]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[blue gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]]. She is often seen with a floating [[stellated octahedron]].

She was originally known as "Quadimensionko", a mascot for the doujinshi group and series [i]Quadimension[/i]. Her [b]quad-tail[/b] hairstyle was created to represent the group.

She is the first VOCALOID for the [i]Voicebank Customize Project[/i] and is not part of the [i]Vsinger project[/i].

h4. Official art
* post #5591917

h4. See also
* [[Cangqiong]]
* [[Haiyi]]

h4. External links
* "Official page":http://quad-stardust.com/
* "Official Twitter account":https://twitter.com/quad_stardust
* "Official YouTube account":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQJzNUVrMgQDg8IslOQak_A
* "Wikipedia article (Chinese)":[https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/星塵_(Vocaloid)]

title: magical_star_(millie_(mahoustars))
body:
[[Millie (Mahoustars)]]'s OC, who also functions as their [[Indie Virtual YouTuber]] persona. They are a magical enby of feminine appearance.

Their [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[pink hair|pink]]-and-[[blonde hair|yellow]] [[gradient hair]] is tied into [[twintails]] with [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|bows]] and decorated with [[star hair ornament|stars]]. They also have [[sidelocks]], [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[bangs]] and [[yellow eyes]] with [[star in eye|stars in them]], along with [[cat other|cat]] [[cat ears|ears]] (with [[animal ear fluff|fluff]]) and [[cat tail|tail]] with a [[tail ribbon|ribbon]] and a [[tail bell|bell]].

When transformed, they can be seen wearing a [[pink choker]] with [[frilled choker|frills]] and a [[neck bell|bell]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[tied sleeves|tied]] [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[frilled sailor collar|frilled]] [[pink sailor collar|pink]] [[sailor shirt|sailor]] [[sailor collar|collar]], a [[pink bowtie|pink]] [[bowtie]] with a star-shaped [[brooch]], [[white gloves|white]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[gloves]], [[suspenders]], a [[pink skirt|pink]] [[overskirt]], a [[miniskirt|short]] [[white skirt|white]] [[bubble skirt]], a pair of [[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[striped thighhighs|striped]] [[thighhighs]] and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[shoes]] with [[footwear bow|bows]].

Note that the artist consistently refers to the character as nonbinary and uses they/them pronouns for them - that being said, they do occasionally call Magical Star feminine terms such as "[[magical girl]]" and "[[catgirl]]", likely out of convenience.

h4. See also
* [[Estella (Millie (MahouStars))]] (Magical Star's familiar)
* [[Magical Star (Halloween Outfit) (Millie (MahouStars))]]
* [[Magical Star (Regular Outfit) (Millie (MahouStars))]]
* [[Magical Star (Valentine's Outfit) (Millie (MahouStars))]]
* [[Magical Star (Super Outfit) (Millie (MahouStars))]]

h4. External links
* "Character design sheet (ToyHouse)":[https://toyhou.se/4489222.magical-star#56941870]

title: free_hugs
body:
A [[sign]] offering a free [[hug]], part of a social movement involving individuals who offer hugs to strangers in public places. The hugs are meant to be random acts of kindness, performed selflessly just to make others feel better. An Australian man known only by the pseudonym "Juan Mann" started the Free Hugs Campaign as it is known today in 2004, and International Free Hugs Month is celebrated on the first Saturday of July and continues until August 1st.

h4. See also

* [[free sex sign]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Free Hugs Campaign":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_Hugs_Campaign

title: zweihander
body:
[i]For "a character":[http://www18.atwiki.jp/pazdra/pages/7329.html] from [[Puzzle & Dragons]], use [[Zweihander_(P&D)]].[/i]

The Zweihänder (pronounced "tsvay-haen-dar", literally "two-handed") is a massive late medieval/early Renaissance Germanic [[sword]] with a long hilt and two parrying hooks located above the ricasso (the unsharpened lower length of a blade), allowing it to be wielded similarly to a [[polearm]]. Due to its large size it required two hands to wield, hence the name. It was used in place of a [[halberd]] against cavalry and pike formations.

Commonly associated with the historical [[Landsknecht]], and in modern times is a fantastic weapon in [[Dark Souls I]].

h4. See also
* [[Greatsword]]

title: gt_world_challenge_europe
body:
The European branch of the GT World Challenge motorsport series, officiated by the SRO Motorsports Group. Out of the four GTWC series (Europe, [[gt world challenge america|America]], Asia, and [[gt world challenge australia|Australia]]), Europe has the largest participation and is widely considered the premier league for GT3 [[racing]].

GTWCE's premier event is the 24 Hours of Spa, held yearly at [[Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps]]. The event usually sees a very large grid, often featuring one-time entries from teams that usually participate in the other GTWC regions or non-SRO GT3 series.

title: intercontinental_gt_challenge
body:
A motorsports series officiated by SRO, consisting of the most prestigious endurance events in the SRO calendar. Each race is currently considered both part of the IGTC and the corresponding GT World Challenge region, with the exception of the Nurburgring 24 hour race which only became part of the IGTC for the first time in 2024 and is treated as a standalone event.

h4. Events
[b]Current[/b]
* [[mount panorama circuit|Bathurst 12 Hour]] ([[GT World Challenge Australia|Australia]])
* [[nurburgring|24H Nurburgring]]
* [[circuit de spa-francorchamps|24 Hours of Spa]] ([[GT World Challenge Europe|Europe]])
* Indianapolis 8 Hour ([[GT World Challenge America|America]])

[b]Former[/b]
* Sepang 12 Hours
* [[suzuka international racing course|Suzuka 10 Hours]]
* California 8 Hours (Laguna Seca)
* Kyalami 9 Hours
* [[Yas Marina Circuit|Gulf 12 Hours]]

title: eavesdropping
body:
Listening to a conversation in which the listener is not directly involved. Usually done in a room separate from where the conversation is taking place. The word comes from the practice of using eavesdrops (gutters that catch rainwater from the eaves of a house) to listen to other people's conversations.

Not to be confused with [[voyeurism]].

title: world_cup
body:
The [b]FIFA World Cup[/b] is a major international [[soccer]] championship held every four years in a different country. The [b]FIFA Women's World Cup[/b] is held a year later.

The most recent World Cup was held in Qatar in 2022 ([[2022 FIFA World Cup]]).

h4. World Cup
* [[1986 FIFA World Cup]] (held in [[Mexico]])
* [[2002 FIFA World Cup]] (jointly hosted by [[Japan]] and [[South Korea]])
* [[2006 FIFA World Cup]] (held in [[Germany]])
* [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] (held in [[South Africa]])
* [[2011 FIFA Women's World Cup]] (held in [[Germany]])
* [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] (held in [[Brazil]])
* [[2015 FIFA Women's World Cup]] (held in [[Canada]])
* [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] (held in [[Russia]])
* [[2022 FIFA World Cup]] (held in [[Qatar]])

h4. See also

* [[FIFA World Cup Trophy]]

title: michael_jackson
body:
[b]Michael Joseph Jackson[/b] (29 August 1958 - 25 June 2009) was an American singer and songwriter who rose prominence as a solo artist during the 1980s.

Better known as the "King of Pop", he is a recording artist, dancer, and entertainer, and one of the most successful entertainers of all time. Best known for his unusual dance moves.

h4. Notable songs

* [[bad_(song)|Bad]] (1987)
* [[Billie Jean]] (1982)
* [[Remember the Time]] (1992)
* [[Smooth Criminal]] (1988)
* [[Thriller (michael jackson)|]] (1982)

h4. See also

title: nitrous_oxide_systems
body:
A brand of automotive parts produced by Holley Performance, Nitrous Oxide Systems (more commonly known as NOS for short) primarily produces nitrous injection systems and related parts. Their most recognizable product is a blue nitrous canister with an orange sticker displaying the brand logo and safety warnings.

[[NOS Energy Drink]] is a licensed drink inspired by NOS cans and produced by [[Monster Energy]].

title: why_do_women_only_like_stupid_jerks_who_treat_them_like_shit?_(meme)
body:
A webcomic created by Humon Comics which in the first panel shows a boy looking at an attractive couple asking why women fall for guys who treat them poorly; in the second panel, a girl looking at that boy asks why men fall for "bitchy bimbos who walk all over them"; in the third panel, the man from the attractive couple looks at the girl from the second panel and asks "Why can't I get her attention?". The third panel is often altered to something nonsensical.

h4. External links
* "Original comic: Only jerks and bimbos":https://humoncomics.com/only-jerks-and-bimbos

title: mini_gt
body:
A line of 1/64 [[toy car]]s by TrueScale Miniatures. Mini GT's cars are primarily aimed at adult collectors looking for detailed replicas, offering a variety of standard street cars, real world [[racecar]]s, and modified cars with bodykits by famous tuning houses.

Most of the motorsports replicas produced by Mini GT are based on the [[IMSA SportsCar Championship]]. Other series that they've made cars for include [[Formula One]], [[Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters]], [[Super GT]], [[D1 Grand Prix]], [[Formula Drift]], [[World Rally Championship]], [[World Endurance Championship]], and [[GT World Challenge Europe]].

title: manica
body: A manica is a type of bronze or iron arm guard made of segmented, overlapping plates fastened by leather straps. Manica were worn by Roman gladiators and sometimes soldiers.

title: korok
body:
A race of plant beings in the [i][[the legend of zelda|Legend of Zelda]][/i] franchise. 

In their first appearance in [i][[The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker]][/i], they essentially take the place of the [[Kokiri]], with their own [[Great Deku Tree]]. Later appearances would still have them with a deep connection to the environment, and many of them are childlike.

h4. Notable Korok
* [[Hestu]]
* [[Makar]]

title: kokiri
body:
Tribe in [i][[The Legend of Zelda]][/i] series which is ruled by the [[Great Deku Tree]], whose best known appearances were from [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time]][/i]. They look like children but are not human. Also, they live in close touch with nature and never become older.

The race is related to the [[Korok]].


h4. Notable Kokiri

title: takamichi_wakaba
body: The protagonist of the original setting of [[kenkyo kenjitsu wo motto ni ikite orimasu |Kenkyo, Kenjitsu wo Motto ni Ikite Orimasu!]], KimiDol. She is a commoner who enters Suiran Academy externally as a scholarship student due to her outstanding grades. title: kenkyo_kenjitsu_wo_motto_ni_ikite_orimasu
body:
Kenkyo, Kenjitsu wo Motto ni Ikite Orimasu!, lit. [i]I Will Live with Humility and Dependability as My Motto[/i] is an ongoing Japanese web-novel series by Hiyoko no Keiki (ひよこのケーキ) that was published on Shousetsuka ni Narou since 2013.

One of the progenitors of the modern "villainess reincarnation" genre along with [[otome_game_no_hametsu_flag_shika_nai_akuyaku_reijou_ni_tensei_shite_shimatta |Hamefura]], it is about a girl who gets reincarnated into the Shoujo romance manga of KimiDol as the main antagonist, [[Kisshouin Reika]], and her attempts to avoid her downfall with "Humility and Dependability as her motto".

h5. Characters
* [[Kisshouin Reika]]
* [[Kaburagi Masaya]]
* [[Enjou Shuusuke]]
* [[Takamichi Wakaba]]
* [[Mizusaki Arima]]
* [[Kisshouin Takateru]]
* [[Kotou Ririna]]
* [[Enjou Yukino]]

h4. See Also

* "Web-Novel Page":http://ncode.syosetu.com/n4029bs/
other_names: 謙虚、堅実をモットーに生きております!

title: kaburagi_masaya
body: The main male romance of the original setting of [[kenkyo kenjitsu wo motto ni ikite orimasu |Kenkyo, Kenjitsu wo Motto ni Ikite Orimasu!]], KimiDol. The headstrong and talented heir to the Kaburagi conglomerate (the richest Kaibutsu in Japan of the setting), he is often called "L'Empereur", due to a cavalry battle in middle school.

title: nishida_satono
body:
[b]The All-Too-Dangerous Backup Dancers[/b]

A [i][[Touhou]][/i] character, introduced as one of the stage 5 bosses in [i][[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]][/i].

Satono has [[short hair|short]], [[brown_hair|brown hair]] which she often wears with [[short hair with long locks|two locks]]. She wears a [[purple dress]] with [[frills]] and a [[waist apron|waist apron]]. Her dress is decorated with [[bow|bows]] and [[ribbon|ribbons]]. She has [[purple eyes|purple eyes]]. She wears [[purple footwear|purple]] [[shoes]] with a pair of [[black thighhighs]]. Her hat is a [[tate eboshi|kazaori eboshi]].

Along with [[teireida mai|Mai]], she is based after Matarajin's two servants, Nishida and Teireida respectively. Like her mythological counterpart, she is depicted holding a [[myouga (plant)|myouga plant]] in her character portrait.

Satono and Mai are [[matara okina|Okina's]] loyal servants. They used to be human children, but Okina's magic made them less human. They dance for Okina's sake and are essentially an extension of Okina's power. Satono is depicted as discreet but overconfident. Her abilities allow her to draw out one's mental energy by dancing behind them.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Satono Nishida":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Satono_Nishida

title: kisshouin_reika

title: visas_starfrost
body:
Headlining protagonist of his own [[Duel Monster]] storyline. On a quest to recover his emotions while journeying across the worlds. His fragmented emotions are [[Scareclaw Reichheart]], [[Tearlaments Reinoheart]], and [[Kashtira Riseheart]]. His inner joy is [[Mannadium Riumheart]]. Once he fuses with his emotions, he becomes [[Visas Samsara]].

He is often paired up with [[Tearlaments Kitkallos]] as she's the closest thing to a heroine in Visas's storyline.

body:

While the game's cover car is a [[Nissan GT-R]], the most well known car from the title is a beat-up green S13 Nissan 240SX (essentially a US market [[Nissan 180sx|180SX]]) used as protagonist [[Ryan Cooper]]'s starter car.

title: spyke_(splatoon)
body:
Merchant NPC from [[Splatoon_(series)|]]. Called [b]Daunii[/b] in the Japanese version.

A homeless sea urchin that lives in the alleyways of Inkopolis. Players can request gear from other players through him, though he asks for higher prices than how they'd normally go for in their respective stores. If one gives him a [[Super Sea Snail]], he can outfit the players' gear with an extra ability slot.

Has a [[skinny]] body and urchin-like [[spiked hair]] in [[Splatoon 2]].

title: palworld
body:
[b]Palworld[/b] is an open-world survival monster-collection [[video game]] developed by Pocket Pair released in January 2024. The gameplay enables the [[player character (palworld)|player]] to befriend (or enslave) and collect mysterious creatures called [[pal (creature)|]]s in a vast world. Pals can fight for the player, build, farm, and work in factories.

Notable for its [[Pokemon|Pokémon]]-like aesthetics, but with full-blown violence, such as [[gun]]s and animal (i.e. pal) cruelty.

h4. See also

body:
A fairy with a [[panda costume]], he is [[Shiranui Flare]]'s former channel [[mascot]].

His appearance matched with Flare's [[Shiranui Flare (old design)|original default]], being red and white while she is in her New Years outfit or wearing a "mysterious masked gentleman" outfit along with Flare's vintage casual outfit. title: oribe_tsubasa
body:
[b]Tsubasa Oribe[/b] (織部 つばさ Oribe Tsubasa) is the deuteragonist of [i][[Tokyo Mirage Sessions FE|Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE]][/i].

Tsubasa is a high school student and friend of [[aoi itsuki|Itsuki Aoi]]. She joins Fortuna Entertainment in the hopes of becoming a singer like her idol, [[kurono kiria|Kiria Kurono]], and in hopes of finding her missing sister, [[oribe ayaha|Ayaha]]. She is a Mirage Master, and her Mirage is [[caeda (fire emblem)|Caeda]].

She usually wears her [[school uniform]] for her civilian attire, consisting of a dark [[yellow sweater]], a red [[skirt]], brown [[shoes]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. In her Carnage form, she dons an "idol-esque", feather-themed [[dress]] that represents her Pegasus Knight motif, with themed [[elbow gloves]], [[thigh boots]], dress' skirt and a [[hair ornament]], and which also shows off her [[cleavage]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears black [[short shorts]] underneath her dress.

title: f-14_tomcat
body:
The [b]Grumman F-14 "Tomcat"[/b] was a large and heavy twin-engine [[fighter jet|jet fighter]]-interceptor, first of the "Teen" series of US jet fighters and the last "Cat" manufactured by Bethpage, New York-based Grumman "Iron Works" Aerospace Corporation. The swing-wing two-seater entered service with its main user, the [[United States Navy]], in 1974 and was retired in 2006. However, [[Iran]], the only country that the F-14 was exported to (prior to the 1979 revolution), still operates the type with local modification.

The F-14 is widely recognized in various forms of pop culture. It was prominently featured in the movie [[Top Gun]], in a large number of air combat [[video game]]s and flight simulators, and furthermore is the visual model on which the [[MACROSS]] [[VF-1]] [i]Valkyrie[/i] is loosely based.

The F-14 was armed with an M61 20mm cannon in the nose and carried TARPS and ROVER systems for reconnaissance. Air-to-air weapons included the long-range AIM-54 Phoenix, AIM-7 Sparrow and AIM-9 Sidewinder. For ground attack missions a variety of freefall and precision guided munitions could be carried.

h4. See also

* [[Ace Combat]]
* [[Area 88]]
* [[Macross Zero]]
* [[VF-0]]
* [[After Burner]]
* [[List of Airplanes]]

title: yugoslavia
body: A former country in the Balkans, formed following the First World War. Originally a monarchy until the Second World War, when a [[communism|Communist]] regime came to power largely (and then fully) independent of [[Soviet]] influence. Broke up during the 1990s in a series of wars caused by economic issues and ethnic tension, from which the countries of [[Slovenia]], [[Croatia]], [[North Macedonia]], [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]], [[Montenegro]], and [[Serbia]] (and [[Kosovo]]) emerged (the latter three remaining together and using the Yugoslavia name until 2003, when the state became just Serbia and Montenegro, before the latter left in 2006, and Kosovo declared independence in 2008).

title: lelouch_vi_britannia
body:
The main protagonist of [[Code Geass]], also known by his civilian alias [b]Lelouch Lamperouge[/b].

A former heir of the oppressive Britannian Empire, who take refuge to Area 11 (the Britannian-occupied Japan) after falling out of favor. After his encounter with mysterious [[C.C.]]. Lelouch gained a supernatural power known as [[Geass]], which is capable of [[mind control|controlling anyone who look into his eye to do whatever he wishes]]. He later assumed the persona of [[Zero_(code_geass)|]] to hides his identity as he leads the resistance Black Knights on a quest to defeat the Britannian Empire and liberate the world.

title: pride_flag_question_mark_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] consists of a [[rainbow flag]] and question mark (🏳️‍🌈?) superimposed onto an image that seems to suggest that those involved were homosexuals. 

The meme became a popular exploitable in image macros in October 2022, with overlayed text displaying the 🏳️‍🌈? alongside anime, movie and TV show characters.

Some variations of the meme use other pride flags, such as the [[lesbian flag]], [[bisexual flag]], [[transgender flag]], etc.

h4. See also
* [[LGBT pride]]
* [[Rainbow flag]]

h4. External links
* "Know your meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/%F0%9F%8F%B3%EF%B8%8F%F0%9F%8C%88-pride-flag-question-mark]

title: ernesto_de_la_cruz
body:
A fictional character from the [[3D]] animated film, [[Coco (Disney)]].

[b]Ernesto de la Cruz[/b] is the most famous musician in the history of Mexico and [[miguel rivera|Miguel]]'s idol. Revered by fans worldwide until his untimely death, the charming and charismatic musician is even more beloved in the Land of the Dead. He's portrayed as a walking [[skeleton]] with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], a [[mustache]] and [[brown eyes]]. He wears a [[charro]] suit, featuring a [[jacket]] with [[bow]] and a [[sombrero]].

[spoiler]He was the childhood friend and musical partner of [[hector rivera|Héctor Rivera]] when he was alive. Ernesto murdered him to get his songbooks after Héctor choose to return to his family back home instead of becoming famous.[/spoiler]

Routinely appears in Inmu parodies in the form of "Spinning Yajuu Senpai":[https://nico.ms/sm14998129], a spinning record with his face on it. title: ts_eiseihei-san_no_senjou_nikki
body:
TS Eiseihei-san no Senjou Nikki (lit. TS Medic's Battlefield Diary) is a Japanese web novel turned light novel series written by Masaki Tama and illustrated by [[Kureta_(nikogori)|]], with a manga adaptation by [[Mimishiki]].  The series is an isekai set in a WWI-ish war with magic.  The TS in the title is short for Transsexual, which refers to the Transsexual Fantasy genre, ie series involving genderswapping.

The story follows [[Touri Noel]], a 15-year-old girl who was a male in her past life and a skilled FPS player.  After learning she could use healing magic, she left the Noel Orphanage and volunteered to join the military following a childhood friend.  Assuming she could make use of her FPS knowledge to succeed on the battlefield, she quickly learns the reality of war is a very different and very brutal thing as she tries to stay alive.
other_names: TS衛生兵さんの戦場日記

title: imjin_war
body:
A war between 1592 and 1598 between the the Toyotomi [[shogun|shogunate]] and the [[Joseon dynasty]], with the latter being supported by their suzerain, the [[Ming dynasty]].

Japan quickly succeeded in occupying large portions of the Korean Peninsula, but the contribution of reinforcements by the Ming, as well as the disruption of Japanese supply fleets along the western and southern coasts by the Joseon navy, forced the Japanese forces to withdraw from Pyongyang and the northern provinces. Afterwards, with righteous armies (Joseon civilian militias) conducting guerrilla warfare against the occupying Japanese forces and supply difficulties hampering both sides, neither force was able to mount a successful offensive or gain any additional territory, resulting in a military stalemate.

With [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi|Toyotomi Hideyoshi's]] death in 1598, limited progress on land, and continued disruption of supply lines by the [[Admiral Yi|Joseon navy]], the Japanese forces in Korea were ordered to withdraw back to Japan by the new governing Council of Five Elders. Final peace negotiations between the parties followed, and continued for several years, ultimately resulting in the normalization of relations.

h4. See also
* [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi]]
* [[Ming Dynasty]]
* [[Joseon Dynasty]]

h1. External links:
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_invasions_of_Korea_(1592%E2%80%931598)

title: assault_suit_leynos
body:
[i][b]Assault Suit Leynos[/b][/i] (重装機兵レイノス [i]Jūsō Kihei Reinosu[/i]), released in the U.S.A. as [i][b]Target Earth[/b][/i], is a military [[science fiction]] side-scrolling [[mecha]] action [[video game]] developed by Masaya in 1990 for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] Japanese home console and also for the [b]Sega Genesis[/b] western console.

Set in the far future. Years after a devastating global conflict the United Earth forces face an apparent unknown hostile [[alien]] attack in its [[space]] colonies on the moon "Ganymede":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ganymede_(moon).

It is the first game in the [[Assault Suits Series]]. An indirect prequel/spin-off called [[Assault Suits Valken]] with different characters was released in 1992 for the [[Nintendo]] [[Super Famicom]] Japanese home console.

A sequel to the original Leynos called [i][b]Assault Suit Leynos 2[/b][/i] was released in 1997 for the [[Sega Saturn]] console only in Japan.

The original Leynos has since been re-released on the [[Wii]] as a Virtual Console product in Japan. A HD remake of the first game with new graphics has been also released for the [[PlayStation 4]] console in all the world in 2016.

h4. See also

* [[Leynos]]
* [[Zear Ein]]

title: muteki_koujin_daitarn_3
body:
[b]Invincible Steel Man Daitarn 3[/b] (無敵鋼人ダイターン3, [b]Muteki Kōjin Daitān 3[/b]), also known as [b]The Unchallengeable Daitarn 3[/b], is a [[Japan]]ese [[super robot]] anime television series created by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] and Yatate Hajime, and animated by [[sunrise_(company)|Sunrise]]. 

It was first broadcast on Japanese TV in 1978. The series lasted for 40 episodes. The opening theme [i]Come Here! Daitarn 3[/i] is sung by Fujiwara Makoto ([[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]]). 

Despite being only moderately successful in Japan, the series became very popular abroad, especially in [[Italy]] during the early 1980s.

h4. See also.

* [[Daitarn 3]]

title: kanie_seiya
body:
The protagonist of [i][[Amagi Brilliant Park]][/i]. He is a perfectionist high school student who has mental sharpness, intelligence, excellent reflexes, and acts like a prince.

[spoilers]He used to be involved in the entertainment industry during his childhood and his stage name was Seiya Kodama. According to [[Sento Isuzu|Isuzu]], he was a child who would have made every adult proud; however, Seiya has told her that he died a long time ago. He receives from [[latifa fleuranza|Latifah]] the magical power of listening to a person's heart, although this power only works once with each person.[/spoilers]

[i]Source:"Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amagi_Brilliant_Park#Characters][/i]

title: dom_tropen
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

[b]MS-09F/trop Dom Tropen[/b]

An improved variant of the [[Dom (mobile suit)|]] [[mobile suit]] intended by the Principality of [[Zeon]] to operate in [[desert]] and tropical environments. Among many upgrades were improved cooling for the massive leg thrusters, a more standardized set of weapons and a new 880mm Raketen Bazooka, capable of destroying anything it was fired at in one shot.

title: larry_the_cow
body:
One of [[Gentoo]]'s mascots. 

Larry's head originates from a font labeled Font Heads created in 2000 by Ethan Dunham of Fonthead Design licensed under the EULA of Fonthead Design; it was introduced to Gentoo in 2002 by Daniel Robbins, using it on Gentoo's about section, 404 page, and in certain news posts, under the name "Larry the Cow". 

In 2004, Matteo Pescarin introduced a version of Larry the Cow that included the cow's body.

h4. External links
* "Gentoo Wiki: Logos and Mascots":[https://wiki.gentoo.org/wiki/Project:Artwork/Artwork]

title: irc
body:
[b]IRC[/b], or Internet Relay Chat, is a text-based chat system designed for group communication in discussion forums by Jarkko Oikarinen.in 1988. Users connect from an IRC client to an IRC server, which might be part of a larger IRC network.

The service is popular with FOSS communities; many [[Linux]] distributions maintain an official IRC channel for user support and other project-related conversation.

h4. See also
h5. Popular Clients
* Hexchat
* Irssi
* KiwiIRC
* Konversation
* Pidgin
* Weechat

h5. Popular Networks
* Libera Chat
* Rizon

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IRC":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IRC]
* "LiberaChat":[https://libera.chat/]
* "KiwiIRC":[https://kiwiirc.com/]

title: cheetahmen_ii
body: Unreleased sequel to [[Cheetahmen]] for the [[NES]], found in a Florida warehouse in 1996. It reuses the Action 52 cartridge, but with a [i]Cheetahmen II[/i] label on it. The gameplay remains largely unchanged from the previous game, and is in an incomplete state.

title: no_chill_revenant
body:
Legendary skin for [[Revenant (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], one of two Anniversary skins inspired by [[Caustic (apex legends)|]]'s [[Blackheart caustic|Blackheart]] skin (the other being [[Gibraltar (apex legends)|]]'s [[golden guardian gibraltar|Golden Guardian]] skin).

In this appearance Revenant wears a [[fur-trimmed hood]] with several [[ammunition pouch]]es on his torso.
